definition: aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
surname Yu
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
in/at/to/from/by/than/out of
inner feelings

sentences.english: Mooney spoke about the reasons behind what he calls American inaction on climate change.
sentences.chinese: 莫涅谈及了美国对气候变化无动于衷的原因。

sentences.english: The problem is that most of the cells are still apathetic or disempowered.
sentences.chinese: 问题是大多数的细胞依然无动于衷。

sentences.english: He remained impervious to all nell's sulks and blandishments.
sentences.chinese: 对尼尔的愠怒和甜言蜜语，他都无动于衷。

sentences.english: By that time Haldon had vanished. Duck seemed unconcerned.
sentences.chinese: 那时候哈尔顿早就消失了，鸭子看起来也无动于衷。
“随你的便好啦，”她无动于衷地回答说。

sentences.english: She is indifferent to your love for she shows no concern for you.
sentences.chinese: 她对你的爱情无动于衷，因为她对你毫不关心。

sentences.english: Commentators were underwhelmed by Medvedev's attempts to shape the debate.
sentences.chinese: 评论员们对梅德韦杰夫想形成辩论的努力无动于衷。

sentences.english: Brother see him have a glimpse of indifferent after, straight regard my went up.
sentences.chinese: 兄见他瞟一眼后无动于衷，直顾自己走上去。
与此同时，谷歌仍然无动于衷。

sentences.english: How can you be indifferent to the sufferings of starving people?
sentences.chinese: 你怎能对饥民的疾苦无动于衷呢？

sentences.english: The fact that it's another person should make you care.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该对别人的痛苦无动于衷。

sentences.english: Regarding destroys the vehicle race which is on fire, we see indifferently actually.
sentences.chinese: 对于撞烂起火的赛车，我们见之却无动于衷。

sentences.english: His indifference was a fuel to her hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他无动于衷使她心中的怨恨火上加油。
獠牙妖怪们对我们的游戏无动于衷。

sentences.english: She received the news with apparent unconcern.
sentences.chinese: 她接到这消息时显然无动于衷。

definition: to turn a blind eye to
to remain unmoved
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to heed/to pay attention to
to refuse to acknowledge/to pay no attention to/to take no notice of/to ignore
indifferent/apathetic/cold
a matter of no concern to oneself (idiom)
